intro: Alsine petraea, commonly known as rock sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are usually alternate, linear, and covered in fine hairs. Alsine petraea is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
